history.content: I am confused by your question, but according to this website, you need to satisfy 20 units of Upper Division Units (CS/EE/EECS) and 7 units of Upper Division Technical Electives (CS/EE/EECS/Approved Non-Computer Science). Your can only choose one of those upper division courses to overlap between your major and your minor or two of those upper division courses to overlap between two majors. Check out: double majoring and minoring within the L&S!

I am confused by your question, but according to this website, you need to satisfy 20 units of Upper Division Units (CS/EE/EECS) and 7 units of Upper Division Technical Electives (CS/EE/EECS/Approved Non-Computer Science). Your can only choose one of those upper division courses to overlap between your major and your minor or two of those upper division courses to overlap between two majors. Check out: double majoring and minoring within the L&S!

-----

Specifically: the 20 units you refer to are included in major requirements, yes.

I am confused by your question, but according to this website, you need to satisfy 20 units of Upper Division Units (CS/EE/EECS) and 7 units of Upper Division Technical Electives (CS/EE/EECS/Approved Non-Computer Science). Your can only choose one of those upper division courses to overlap between your major and your minor or two of those upper division courses to overlap between two majors. Check out: double majoring and minoring within the L&S!

I am confused by your question, but according to this website, you need to satisfy 20 units of Upper Division Units and 7 units of Upper Division Technical Electives. Your can only choose one of those upper division courses to overlap between your major and your minor or two of those upper division courses to overlap between two majors. Check out: double majoring and minoring within the L&S!
" 20 units of Approved Non-Computer Science Technical Electives "  <-- Please note that there is no such requirement. Please review the link Halley shared

"Only one upper division course may be used to simultaneously fulfill requirements for a student's major and minor programs. No more than two upper division courses can overlap between two majors." Does this apply to satisfying the 20 units of Approved Non-Computer Science Technical Electives for L&S students?
history.subject: L&C CS Advising Question
